content: How can I help you today?

Well, I've been having a really hard time sleeping lately. There's just so much on my mind—a lot of stress at work and fears that I might lose my job. I can’t seem to stop the thoughts, and it feels overwhelming most nights. My partner really pushed me to talk to someone, so here I am.

That sounds really tough. Stress and overwhelming thoughts can make it so hard to settle down, especially at night when everything feels louder in the quiet. You’ve already taken an important step by talking about what’s been going on—it shows how much you care about finding a way forward. Would you like to share more about what’s been feeling overwhelming or how this has been affecting you?

It's mainly about work. I'm constantly worried about getting fired, especially with all the talks about the company's performance and potential layoffs. I can't stop thinking about how I'll support my family if that happens. By the time I get to bed, my thoughts just won't let me relax, and I end up on my phone trying to distract myself, but I know that's not helping either.

That sounds like a lot to carry, worrying about your job and the impact on your family. It’s understandable that those fears would keep your mind racing, especially when it feels so uncertain. It also makes sense that you're trying to distract yourself—it sounds like you're doing your best to cope even though it’s not helping you unwind the way you need. How has this been affecting other parts of your life, aside from sleep?

It’s definitely spilling into other parts of my life. I feel so tired and irritable during the day, which makes it even harder to focus at work. And at home, I worry I’m not as present with my kids as I should be—I just don’t have the energy. The stress feels like it’s taking over everything.

It sounds like this stress is really taking a toll—not just on your sleep, but on your energy, focus, and the way you want to show up for your family. It’s clear you care deeply about being there for them and doing well at work, but the weight of it all seems to be leaving you drained. With everything you're juggling, has there been anything you’ve found that helps even a little, or are you still searching for relief?

Honestly, nothing has really helped so far. I’ve tried to power through it or tell myself to just stop thinking about things, but that doesn’t seem to work. Sometimes I’ll try to watch something on my phone or scroll through social media to escape, but it just feels like a cycle that keeps me up even later. I guess I don’t really know what else to do.

It sounds like you’ve been trying hard to find ways to cope—whether by powering through or distracting yourself—but none of it feels like it’s really breaking the cycle. It’s frustrating when the things you try don’t bring the relief you’re hoping for. You’re clearly putting in effort, even when it feels stuck right now. What do you think might help things feel less overwhelming, if you could imagine a shift?

Maybe if I could find a way to actually relax and quiet my thoughts before bed, it would help me sleep better. But honestly, I don’t know how to even start doing that—my brain feels like it’s on overdrive all the time. It’s hard to imagine things getting better when the stress at work isn’t going anywhere.

It sounds like finding a way to calm your mind and ease into sleep feels like it might make a difference, even though it’s hard to picture how right now with so much stress still looming. Your brain being on overdrive must make it seem like there’s no off-switch. Even though work feels unpredictable, it’s really strong that you’re thinking about ways to take care of yourself amidst all this uncertainty. What do you think stands in the way of making that space to relax at night?
Sorry to interrupt, but I think I am okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
